availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Pennsylvania
City & County of Philadelphia } Ss

I, Theodore D. Rand a Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky, duly appointed and commissioned by the Governor thereof for the State of Pennsylvania, resident in the said City and County, do solemnly swear that I will well and faithfully and truly execute and perform all the duties of my station as such Commissioner under and by virtue of the Laws of the State of Kentucky
Sworn and subscribed before me this 15th day of March A. D 1865

Witness my hand & Official Seal
Hugh W. Tener
Commissioner of Kentucky
for Pennsylvania --

figure.ab:
HUGH W. TENER
COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS.
PHILADELPHIA
PENNA:

body.p:
Comr of Deeds
Pennsylvania
comdmission Dated 1st Mch/65
&
Oath of Office filed 18th Mch/65
